fullText: The show is a visual feast, with choreography that flows like liquid poetry across the stage, transforming Sufjan Stevens' intricate compositions into a living, breathing theatrical experience.
bwwExcerpt:
There’s no denying that Illinoise is effective, a large billboard on Adam Rigg’s industrial-slash-forest set announcing the title as well as other information. It may be that longtime Stevens fans need only hear the material they love now presented as dance to carry on about it.

But providing the cherished songs with a connecting plot hasn’t necessarily resulted in an instantly graspable tale.
